settings.title: The Origin Of OdinLake Brand
settings.text: King.J Chao, OdinLake’s founder, is a freelancer who has an engineering background. He has been working from home all the time and needs simple-designed but ergonomic workspace in his life. So he contacted a college friend who is running a furniture factory. They did a lot of research and finally decided to start it with Ergonomic chairs. They praise highly optimal sitting posture to relieve or avoid back pain from prolonged sitting. They invited the German designer Justus Kolberg to carry out a new design of the product's appearance, creating the current ergonomic chair. After all these, what’s the brand name became a question. One thought came into King.J’d mind, “Odinlake” would be perfect. Combined with the engineering background and factory price, they do believe that Odinlake will provide the most ergonomically-designed and affordable Ergo furniture to people. Now there are only 3 models of chairs online, and a fancy-built electric desk will be coming online soon. Let’s expect it!

settings.title: Underlying Inspiration & Driving Force
settings.text: The task of rethinking the modern workspace will take some time to organically evolve as both employers and employees experiment and settle on what works best for them. It's also a task for self-employed people (or people who are working from home). Office furniture will keep changing based on these needs. Putting people and technology first, no matter where you’re in your home office or a modern building, is Odinlake’s commission.

settings.title: An Office Chair Should Last 10 Years
settings.text: Odinlake uses engineering-grade materials to allow the chair to reach 10 years of service life, much higher than the 2-year service life of chairs on the market. We use class 3 and BIFAMA certified gas lift with lifespan of 35,000 cycles with 10 adjustments per day for 10 years of continuous use. In addition, structural parts added with polymer materials will not oxidize and lose elasticity for 10 years.

settings.title: ECO-Friendly
settings.text: Odinlake is a company focused on environmental protection and sustainability. We produce ergo furniture from renewable and ocean plastics. Each product produced and sold will reduce marine litter by 25 lbs and reduce carbon emissions by 5 lbs. Let us work together to protect the earth's environment！

settings.title: ISO 9000 & Continuous Improvement
settings.text: Odinlake places a high value on quality, following strict Global ISO9000 quality manufacturing standards. Meet the highest office chair production requirements. Odinlake places a high value on product development and updates and highly values user feedback. Therefore, if you have any product advice, you can forward it to us if we accept your advice to improve the next version of the chair. In addition, we will send you an invitation email inviting you to test our chair, which is free for you.

settings.title: Why We Design The Chair
settings.text: Odinlake focuses on solving healthy office problems and provides WFH solutions. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, many companies have advocated working from home, when prolonged sitting can cause a series of physical health problems. Based on medical research, we have created a chair that promotes optimal sitting posture to relieve or avoid back pain from prolonged sitting. Modern office chairs pay attention to practicality and need to pay attention to the beauty of the design. We invited the famous German designer Justus Kolberg to carry out a new design of the product's appearance, creating the current odinlake ergonomic chair.

settings.title:
It pains me physically to see woman victimized,
rendered pathetic by fashion.

Awkwardness gives me great comfort. I’ve never been cool, but I’ve felt cool. I’ve been in the
cool place, but I wasn’t really cool – I was trying to pass for hip or cool.
settings.text: A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous. I am convinced that there can be luxury in simplicity. I wanted to dress the woman who lives and works, not the woman in a painting. It’s hard to balance everything. It’s always challenging. My relationships with producers or photographers – these are relationships that took years. I can’t get sucked into that celebrity thing, because I think it’s just crass. My aim is to make the poor look rich and the rich look poor. Vanity is the healthiest thing in life. I believe that my clothes can give people a better image of themselves – that it can increase their feelings of confidence and happiness. You can hide so much behind theatrics, and I don’t need to do that any more. I don’t really know how to do casual clothes.

settings.title:
The world needs to move fast to make a meaningful
difference in the fight against climate change.
